entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 07 at 6:26PM AKDT until July 07 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Central Interior in Alaska... * Until 700 PM AKDT. * At 625 PM AKDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 47 miles west of Nenana, moving northeast at 20 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warm Temperatures through Sunday... Highest temperatures are expected today and possibly Saturday with temperatures warming into the upper 60s along the northern and central gulf coast and into the low 70s along the southern Gulf coast. A marine layer will continue to rebuild in the overnight hours along the coast through the weekend. This could

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 8:16AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rainfall and Rising River Levels This Weekend... Heavy rainfall across Brooks Range and North Slope will result in rising water levels on streams and rivers. Rainfall totals of 1.0 to 1.5 inches are expected Friday evening through Saturday evening from the Colville River near Umiat east to the Ivishak River. Water levels will rise significantly and may approach
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 8:15AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rainfall and Rising Rivers This Weekend... Heavy rainfall is expect tonight and Saturday across the Central and Eastern Brooks Range. This will cause rising water levels on streams and rivers draining the Central and Eastern Brooks Range this weekend. Rainfall totals of 1.0 to 1.5 inches are expected tonight through Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley

entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 207, 290, 291, 292, 293, 295, 490, AND 491... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT SATURDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 207, 290, 291, 292, 293, 295, 490, AND 491...

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 07 at 2:07PM MDT until July 08 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 207, 290, 291, 292, 293, 295, 490, AND 491... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT SATURDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 207, 290, 291, 292, 293, 295, 490, AND 491...

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Campbell, and east central Bedford Counties and the south central City of Lynchburg through 1045 PM EDT... At 1015 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Evington, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 10:10PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Campbell, northeastern Pittsylvania and northwestern Halifax Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 1010 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brookneal, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 07 at 12:56PM PDT until July 09 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON SATURDAY TO 8 PM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...High temperatures 96 to 102 degrees. Limited relief at night with low temperatures 63 to 71 degrees. * WHERE...Clarkston, Chelan, Oroville, Gifford, Pangborn Airport, Peck, Omak, Entiat, Quincy, Number 1 Canyon, Wenatchee, Number 2
